headline: Senate Republicans win health care bill showdown

President Trump's criticism of Jeff Sessions intensifies. Does he plan to fire the Attorney General? Details when we'll return.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: President Trump ramping up his public criticism of Attorney General Jeff Sessions in a string of early morning tweets accusing him of taking a, quote, "Very weak position investigating Hillary Clinton." The President further explained his displeasure with Sessions during the press conference at the White House this afternoon.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I am disappointed in the Attorney General. He should not have recused himself almost immediately after he took office. And if he was going to recuse himself, he should have told me prior to taking office. And I would have quite simply picked somebody else. I want the Attorney General to be much tougher on the leaks from Intelligence Agencies. I told you before, I am very disappointed with the Attorney General. But we will see what happens. Time will tell.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It has been a bizarre couple of days on this issue. Jesse is looking at me very intently and insisting that he wants to take this one first. So, take it away, Jesse Watters.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Donald Trump is a private sector guy. And if this was the Trump organization, he would expect his in-house counsel to defend him. And he is thinking this is what it's like being President of the United States. My Attorney General should defend me. He will be my protector. Trump feels exposed. Sessions is exposing him by recusing himself. So, he feels exposed, he doesn't like it. I get it. It's not the private sector. He should not be thinking like this, but that's how he thinks. Because that - - in the private sector, that's how a CEO react to someone that did that. On the other hand, I'm listening to talk radio, a lot of people are calling in, saying, you know what? If he dumps Jeff Sessions, I am not going to like that. I am not going to like that a lot. Because Jeff Sessions was in on Trump from the get go. Jeff Sessions was in on Trump from the jump. So, if he dumps him right now, it doesn't look good. Especially if he brings in Rudy Giuliani, he is a New York guy. You know, not tough on immigration. So, Trump is a little bit of a jam here. I understand what he's thinking is because he feels exposed but at the same time a lot of people are feeling from the Trump train that he needs to stick with Jeff Sessions.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't understand the goal here, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Because the President then tweeted that yesterday that his Attorney General was beleaguered. I will say he's beleaguered because of the President undermining him. And then today, he also said in an interview with the "Wall Street Journal," that basically Sessions didn't really like him so much as he liked the crowd size in Alabama. Jeff Sessions won in Alabama by like 97.5 percent of the vote. Maybe they can't do a rally the way that President Trump can. Maybe nobody can. What is the goal here that he's trying to achieve?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You know what this is? This is the President being transparent. Being he asked the motive and telling you, I am personally having a hard time with this. I am frustrated. I am feeling little disappointed. Yes, Jeff was with me from the beginning and he definitely appreciated that. I think the frustration comes from the Mueller investigation, et cetera. So, instead of us sort of wondering what the President thinks about it, it's all playing out, you know, in real time here. I think it is a problem for the President. If he were to fire Jeff Sessions or even if Jeff Sessions were to resign. I don't think the President wants to fire him. I think he's genuinely --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It feels like he wants to humiliate him.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: We thought about it last night, it's not a good idea. But you know, and who is going to replace him and what you're going to do. And I think the optics could be very poor for the President like they were when it seemed like a good idea that the Democrats even supported getting rid of, you know, Comey and then we saw the fallout and the aftermath from that. I think it's distracting at this point in time when you really need to focus on some of the other things that the President is trying to get done like, you know, immigration and tax reform, and health care. And I think it's something that it's now just going to obfuscate instead of providing clarity and progression for --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's interesting. Because the President is mad at Jeff Sessions for not having clairvoyance in order to know that he should recuse himself before he even took office so he would not have been appointed. But shouldn't he also be mad at the people who didn't tell him what accurately happened after the firing of Comey, that the Democrats were not going to celebrate? Like I would be mad at those people who got that wrong.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Right. Because they were telling the President, Democrats is going to love this idea of you firing Comey. And it didn't work. I think in addition to what Kimberly is saying about the optics, it looked terrible for the President to be beating up on his own person. As Newt Gingrich said, loyalty is a two way street. This president demand loyalty. He needs to be loyal to his cabinet members who are busting their butts for him. These ties into our last segment. We're talking about what kind of wins does this president have? What does he racking up? Well, you know what? Jeff Sessions has been somewhat quietly and not quietly racking up wins. He is the guy cracking down on illegal immigrants that the President --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- about sanctuary cities.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Sanctuary cities. He announced just I believe last week a major crackdown on health care fraud.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: The money that we actually want to squeeze out in saying, people --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: But the President feels exposed because Jeff Sessions recused himself from the Russian thing and he feels there is a little bit of disloyalty in that avenue.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Maybe the President should not have gone on Lester Holt and said that he fired Comey for cause and not the memo.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And the President feels like recusing herself was a weak move by Jeff Sessions.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I have to say it was probably not a smart move to go on Lester Holt and say that which caused the whole --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And Jeff Sessions could have also not recused himself and we would not have this problem.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. But then it would not be right. Because in fact he did have contact with Russia. Some of them undisclosed the point.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So what? It's not illegal to have a contact with Russia.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, let me just say, it's not just me. But you have Rudy Giuliani as well as others in the Senate saying, that was the appropriate thing to do. John Cornyn from Texas said today, that was the right move for Jeff Sessions as a law man. He is the nation's top law enforcement officer. He behaved appropriately. This is not about the President's feelings by the way. I don't think he has any bad feelings about the Attorney General. He wants somebody who will fire Robert Mueller and that's what this is about.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He wants someone who is going to get his back.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's more than that too though. He wants somebody that is going to fully investigate as it relates to the unmasking and what happens during the Obama --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: This is like what he said today --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I'm just telling you that that is something that --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I'm telling you, these are political ploys, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Maybe supplemental but not --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It's a political ploys. Don't pay attention to this. Well, my hand is back here talking about leaks.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You know what he's comparing it too? Here's the problem. The President is going like this. Wakes up in the morning, he's going, here's what President Obama had. Holder and Loretta Lynch. Here's what I have. And he's like, what is going on here? That's part of it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes. He can't get such good people.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: But if you -- no, the point is, if you looked in the past, the Attorney General has really been, it's true, an arm of the President.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Let me just say --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And they had Loretta Lynch --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Hold on! Hold on!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They guard the wall.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They guard the wall. He wants someone that is going to guard the wall.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: This is not his personal lawyer.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I understand.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He wants the Attorney General to fire Robert Muller but then what does he do? He says things like today, oh, you should go after Hillary Clinton. Why aren't they investigating dirty, nasty Hillary? Again, what kind of country --

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Here is the other thing, we keep hearing that Jeff Sessions is not talking directly to the President. The President doesn't want to take his call. Their staff is talking to each other. He's not going to resign. Here is an opportunity for the President, I think. His critics say he is emoting on Twitter as you said. So, he vented. Jesse is right. He is mad about the recusal and all of this stuff. He has an opportunity now. Call Jeff Sessions in tomorrow.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Sit down, face to face.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Let's sit down. Let's work together.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right. I think that's what going to happen.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: That's what he'll do.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: They have to sit down face-to-face, they have to talk.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Stop fighting it out over Twitter.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This needs to go over here and then you focus on the things in this lane. Right? Don't slow it down. You are in like the HOV lane, keep going. Don't merge right. You know? That's what I think.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, he can't fire Robert Mueller. And that's the problem. That's why they are stuck. That's why you get a situation where Breitbart --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's supposed to let Loretta Lynch --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Hang on! Where you get Breitbart, you get Mark Levin, you know, you get --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Newt.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- everybody, Newt included, all saying, don't do this. This is the wrong way to go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But sometimes though -- I mean, I do think that they will makeup. But it's also, I guess it's plausible that he would not like it that all of these people are telling him what he can't do and that he will continue to do that very thing.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Some other people need to go before them.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh! Who?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Mysterious, read the paper.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I want to read your mind.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You might pass out and expire.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Tell me, who do you think has to go? Who do you think is going to go first?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think that this health care hasn't happened. A lot of promises made from the President. I personally would be frustrated with that. Especially you have the house and the senate, you got it all, what is the excuse? We all have to go.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You should not beat up on fellow Republicans the way the President is right now.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh my god.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We are going to listen to Juan William's advice.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Juan says don't beat up on Republicans.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. Up next President Trump saying that one of his favorite targets are the media, we will show you what he said next, but first here is a bit more from the President's rally earlier today.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Well he is a young man. He is going back home to mommy. Oh, is he in trouble. He is in trouble! And I will bet his mommy voted for us, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We are continuing our coverage of President Trump make America great again rally in Youngstown, Ohio. Tonight, he took jabs at one of his favorite subjects, the mainstream media.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I am here this evening to cut through the fake news filter and to speak straight to the American people. This has been a difficult week for the media, because I forced them to travel with us all around the country and spend time with tens of thousands of proud Americans, who believe in defending our values, our culture, our borders, our civilization, and our great American way of life! What a dishonest group of people. I will tell you. You know the funny thing is you would think they would want to see our country be great again. You would really think so, but they don't. Some day they will explain it to me why.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So this is what I call the Scaramucci effect. He is back out on the campaign trail. My Washington sources told me this would happen. He is back now fighting against the mainstream media -- effective tactic, Kimberly, go for it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, this is where he revels, ok? This is where he shines. People love it. People watch, they tune in. The numbers are great, because this is quintessential Trump, right and that is what love to see. They Remember candidate Trump and they like to embrace as President Trump. And it is really where he is best in terms of his messaging. And it's more effective than going on twitter, because he is able to reach through the screen and connect. You feel like you are right there embracing and taking in and soaking up, you know the moment. I like when he does this. Dana said too, when he speaks and is not on prompter, and he is extemporaneous, it's very authentic and people are actually sitting there listening and waiting for the next moment.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: One of the reasons Trump beat Hillary was because he was authentic. And when he is now back out there on the campaign trail, so to speak, he is an authentic person that resonates.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, but there is two things I would say. One is that, you know when he goes after the media, I feel like its how he is going after Sessions. I think apparently Jeff Sessions is sort of blowing it off and ignoring it. I think the media is kind of doing it too, because guess what? Trump actually does like Jeff Sessions. They will probably makeup at some point. And yes he does like the media. He did an interview today with the fake media. He did one last week with the fake media. He likes to have them around. This is a lot of bluster and entertainment. I came to the conclusion he doesn't really mean it. Though he is probably going to tell me I am wrong. The other things is I think that there is something missing and something that Anthony Scaramucci the Director of communications can do that would finally make me think that these are even more effective. And that is at the top of the speech, it got to have some sort of news to drive the next day. They are not doing anything. This speech I heard so many times. It's the same thing over and over again. It's effective in those crowds. That if you want to drive the story the next day, you have to put something at the top that every reporter sitting there -- maybe that is the only part you listen to. I know you reporter times.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Oh! You know me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Like, you reporter types that are sitting there at the back. We did a lot of time together back in the day.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: We did.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You know what I mean. You are looking for something right at the top.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: We heard this beat up the media stuff.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Dana said this is the press briefing too, years ago.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: It also cuts through. You are right. The people want to hear it. It's authentic. But they will harness that energy, harness going around the filter with some meat about tax cuts, for example. Newt Gingrich said today, he has to get tax cuts by thanksgiving. You will see people going into the Christmas season spending all kinds of money and the stock market will rise as it already is. And then, that is the best revenge for this President.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Against the resistance. He is laying the ground for tax cuts. This rallies in July.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Instead of fighting in which Jeff Sessions said.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's not too soon. I mean they should do that right now. They are working very aggressively around the clock on the tax reform, because they know that is a winning narrative, that they should like you said, pave the road right now with their best messenger.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well but you know what? The reality is they are spending time not on tax reform but on trying to resuscitate health care. And when I watch this kind of thing, this performance that you guys are so enthusiastic about it, I think not only I have seen it before, at just some point, you just want to say this is like a branded circus. It's quite entertaining. And everybody says horrible things about the immigrants and the blacks in Chicago and horrible things about --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He never said anything about blacks in Chicago.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know when he talks about -

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Talking about

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- the murders, on-going murders.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He is upset about the loss of life. How is that negative?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I got a different message. His concern is they are out of control in a Democratic City and its black. I just find it off putting.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Off putting to care about blacks in Chicago?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, believe me, he is not caring.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I think that is an outrageous statement.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The President doesn't care that blacks are getting killed.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That is why he offered help?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, if you allow me to speak.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I am.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He is in fact speaking to an all-white audience. And I think pushing the fair button. New York is being devastated. These immigrants are slicing and dicing 15-year-old girls. That is the message that is coming through Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think the message is coming through that he cares that people are dying on the streets of Chicago and he wants to save American lives.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Let me just tell you how much --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He is breaking news tonight, the Justice Department, crackdown against sanctuary cities. I will tell you what they are doing, up next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Some breaking news tonight. The Justice Department is announcing its escalating the crackdown on sanctuary cities. The Department of Justice says that it won't give some cities some law enforcement grant money unless they give federal immigration authorities access to jails. They also want alerts when someone facing deportation that is about to be release from local custody. President Trump further addressed his immigration agenda and the border wall at tonight's rally.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Don't even think about it. We will build the wall. Don't even think about it. I watched the media as they say -- well he just had some fun during the campaign on the wall. That wasn't fun, folks. We are building that wall, and walls do work. We will have great people come into our country, but we are not going to put ourselves through the problems that we have had for so many years. American cities should be sanctuaries for law-abiding Americans. For people that look up to the law. For people that respect the law. Not for criminals and gang members that we want the hell out of our country!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So this is a critical moment, because here you have the sanctuary cities now under direct attack in terms of grant money coming from Justice. The President still out there talking about the wall, is it going to change anything? Or is this just static? Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well -

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Jesse (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, law enforcement is split. You do have some law enforcement, chiefs of police saying this not a good idea, that we need to have sanctuary cities that allow us to gather the intelligence to protect people. They are not loud enough actually. This message is swamping Democrats. Just from a political perspective, I do think it's extremely difficult for Democrats as it continues for them to oppose this policy. That sanctuary city is a really smart thing for the President to talk about. He can talk about the wall as well, simultaneously, but this piece is very important. We saw the Justice Department and the Attorney General Jeff Sessions is actually the one driving this trend.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I just want to mention to you guys the latest Fox poll asked the questioned, how likely, do you think it is the congress will approve funding to build a wall on the U.S. Mexico border, 56 percent said not at all. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Prototypes are already being developed and the wall is going to be beautiful. You can see through the other side according to some of the new prototypes for the patrol can see the other side which is very advantageous, so you could see all of the drugs being catapulted across.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Because that is very dangerous Juan. Listen the wall will be built. It will be beautiful. And it is going to happen. It's going to be big. If Trump doesn't build the wall, it would be such a big problem for his base, for the presidency. If this thing doesn't get built and it will be built soon, but if it doesn't get built, it gets slowed down by Paul Ryan, there will be hell to pay. You remember the funding last session, they didn't give it money. If they don't give it money this September it will be a huge problem.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He will want to fire Ryan.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Without building the wall or beleaguered Jeff Sessions moving forward fully on this, the number of border crossings has dramatically decreased.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: you know as I always say, build the wall.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Build the wall.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Right and that is actually a success for this administration.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Down 70 percent, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: That is a big deal.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: There you go, Juan. That is Trump winning again.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I get so tired of the winning --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Take a nap, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I should. I will lay on your shoulder.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He needs a 5-hour energy drink.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The fact you have people in the Republican congress not giving the money, Jesse opinion and saying we don't care. He talks about the wall, Kimberly and the crowd gets fired up.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: They love it, they love the wall. The President is 100 percent intent on building the wall and seeing it through. That is a fact. And when you see that coupled with the rest of his policies in terms of immigration cracking down on this and making sure we have national security as a priority, border security, you see what is happening in the courtrooms across the country. The crackdowns on sanctuary cities as a prosecutor was long over do. And guess what, ICE is falling too. Guess what people are doing these days, Juan, they are doing their job. They are following the law. They know the President is behind them and the AG's office as well. That is why we are seeing this big hit on ms-13 and criminal trafficking.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, but I got to say, they are deporting people who have made a misdemeanor for a broken headlight.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, false, false!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: This is so wrong and so, damaging to our values as Americans.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You are trying to -

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know how to get the wall built?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Do want to focus on traffic?

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Focus on the real point, Juan.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Seriously, he gets a health care bill and gets the tax cuts. Then the lawmakers up there are going to see momentum. And they are going to actually be scared of the president if they see the popularity poll.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: If he gets tax cuts, the President will get money for the wall.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Until he breaks this log jam, he is not getting the wall.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But it is hard for him to break the log jam and in fact --

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: But he is trying one step at a time.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, because he hasn't been efficient on health care, but when it comes to something like tax reform.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Hang on. Pass the bill in the house. That is a success, right?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: As opposed to the bill failing, it passed, so that is a success. Number two, this motion to proceed that you and others scoffed that, he will never get that, he got it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I didn't scoff at that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You won't acknowledge the fact he got it through in the house.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think let's likely.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He calls it a bad bill and then has a party in the Rose Garden and you guys want to call it --

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: I said it in the beginning of the show, I called it a mistake.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He said you are wrong.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: He moved the ball forward is the point. Now the U.S. Senates will debate this despite everyone saying it was dead.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Putting humpty-dumpty back together again. The Republicans are totally fragmented to.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Go to Arizona and talk to the people who have 120 percent increases in their premiums.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right so let's go to John McCain.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Did he not come back to have this vote. I am sorry read the tea leaves, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: your prediction?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: My prediction is this will get done. Because there are people have to get it done or they are beat it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: They will beat it because they will suffer at the polls if Americans lose medical coverage in order to get President Trump a victory he can crow about.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Not the same. Constituents support the President.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This is a Fox News alert. President Trump has just arrived at joint base Andrew is following his Make America Great Again Rally in Youngstown Ohio. Now, our final thoughts on this busy news night. Ed?

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Me first.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You are ready to roll.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Wow! I am just proud that Watters did not steal anything from me. Previous programs, he hasn't come up with original thoughts so he usually turns to me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: How dare you Henry.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: That is the truth. I am just happy to be here, because I think it is a lively discussion. I think Juan took some hits.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You think?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Juan is used to. That he has bite marks on his body. He likes it.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: This was a good day for the President. The emotions that everyone thought was dead around July 4th, they are moving forward on this.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: The President and the first lady at joint base Andrews, waving to everybody as he returns to D.C. after his make America great again rally in Youngstown, Ohio.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You know what I like? President Obama never held on to the railing when he went down the stairs and it drove me crazy. This is much safer. They are both holding the railing and walking slowly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Make America safe again.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: A final thought. Go to Foxnews.com, breaking news about a former I.T. staffer from Debbie Wasserman Schultz's office who has questionable things going on with computer equipment that was destroyed and then arrested.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: She doesn't want to turn it over. And now he is being charge with bank fraud

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This is my final thought. Arrested at the airport at Dulles and charged with bank fraud. There is something there and we will try get, more tomorrow.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That is a huge story that needs to be covered -- tremendous national security implications, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dana Perino is actually downplaying the story. They smashed those hardrives with hammers. Be specific about how they destroyed the hard drives.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: They got their home depot on.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We should ask Ed who famously asked Hillary Clinton about wiping?

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Wipe the server.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: She did with a cloth.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Did some staffers use hammers?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There you go. My final thought.

utterances.speaker: HENRY
utterances.sentences: Beleaguered.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: For all of the rose colored glasses. What a wonderful day, it seems to me at some point you have to deal with the idea that President Trump has been unable to solidify a Republican vote behind a health care plan and Obamacare looks safer than ever.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We will see about that Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Send Juan Williams a whole truck load of (inaudible) for that one. All right, it's a big night here on the Fox News Channel. "Hannity" is next followed by a live edition of "Special Report with Bret Baier" at 11 p.m. Eastern. We will see you back here tomorrow. Good night from New York City.
